body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310)

comment_data.body: When is NULL expected? Is it expected at all? Isn't this comment misleading?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -66,95 +67,113 @@ struct Tox_Options;
  * becomes corrupted, the data will be entirely unrecoverable.
  * Ditto if they forget their password, there is no way to recover the data.
  */
-
-/* Since apparently no one actually bothered to learn about the module previously,
- * the recently removed functions tox_encrypted_new and tox_get_encrypted_savedata
- * may be trivially replaced by calls to tox_pass_decrypt -> tox_new or
- * tox_get_savedata -> tox_pass_encrypt as appropriate. The removed functions
- * were never more than 5 line wrappers of the other public API functions anyways.
- * (As has always been, tox_pass_decrypt and tox_pass_encrypt are interchangeable
- *  with tox_pass_key_decrypt and tox_pass_key_encrypt, as the client program requires.)
- */
-
 typedef enum TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION {
+
+    /**
+     * The function returned successfully.
+     */
     TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION_OK,
+
     /**
-     * Some input data, or maybe the output pointer, was null.
+     * One of the arguments to the function was NULL when it was not expected.
      */
     TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION_NULL,
+
     /**
      * The crypto lib was unable to derive a key from the given passphrase,
      * which is usually a lack of memory issue. The functions accepting keys
      * do not produce this error.
      */
-    TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION_FAILED
+    TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION_FAILED,
+
 } TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION;
 
+
 typedef enum TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION {
+
+    /**
+     * The function returned successfully.
+     */
     TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION_OK,
+
     /**
-     * Some input data, or maybe the output pointer, was null.
+     * One of the arguments to the function was NULL when it was not expected.
      */
     TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION_NULL,
+
     /**
      * The crypto lib was unable to derive a key from the given passphrase,
      * which is usually a lack of memory issue. The functions accepting keys
      * do not produce this error.
      */
     TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION_KEY_DERIVATION_FAILED,
+
     /**
      * The encryption itself failed.
      */
-    TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION_FAILED
+    TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION_FAILED,
+
 } TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION;
 
+
 typedef enum TOX_ERR_DECRYPTION {
+
+    /**
+     * The function returned successfully.
+     */
     TOX_ERR_DECRYPTION_OK,
+
     /**
-     * Some input data, or maybe the output pointer, was null.
+     * One of the arguments to the function was NULL when it was not expected.

comment_data.body:
>`tox_pass_key_derive_from_pass()`

Redundant department of redundant redundancy is calling. This function doesn't make much sense as far as the name goes.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -190,59 +222,66 @@ typedef struct {
  *
  * returns true on success
  */
-bool tox_derive_key_from_pass(const uint8_t *passphrase, size_t pplength, TOX_PASS_KEY *out_key,
-                              TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION *error);
+bool tox_pass_key_derive_from_pass(struct Tox_Pass_Key *_key, const uint8_t *passphrase, size_t pplength,

@@ -190,59 +222,66 @@ typedef struct {
  *
  * returns true on success
  */
-bool tox_derive_key_from_pass(const uint8_t *passphrase, size_t pplength, TOX_PASS_KEY *out_key,
-                              TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION *error);
+bool tox_pass_key_derive_from_pass(struct Tox_Pass_Key *_key, const uint8_t *passphrase, size_t pplength,
+                                   TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION *error);
 
-/* Same as above, except use the given salt for deterministic key derivation.
+/**
+ * Same as above, except use the given salt for deterministic key derivation.
  * The salt must be TOX_PASS_SALT_LENGTH bytes in length.
  */
-bool tox_derive_key_with_salt(const uint8_t *passphrase, size_t pplength, const uint8_t *salt, TOX_PASS_KEY *out_key,
-                              TOX_ERR_KEY_DERIVATION *error);
+bool tox_pass_key_derive_with_salt(struct Tox_Pass_Key *_key, const uint8_t *passphrase, size_t pplength,

comment_data.body:
No errors are possible? Should this actually read `TOX_PASS_KEY_LENGTH` bytes from given place in memory?
Why there are no docs on how to use it?
If it's something that shouldn't be used, why there's an API for it?

Same goes for other functions.

Sometimes NULL is accepted. `is_data_encrypted` just returns `false`, because NULL is not encrypted. This comment is generated by apidsl. Feel free to file a bug or make a PR with different wording there: https://github.com/TokTok/apidsl/issues.

comment_regular_data.body:
Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks failed.

---



*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->
Added to v0.1.0. I'll push it to v0.2.0 if we can't get it reviewed on time.

Review status: 0 of 6 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion.

---

*[toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h, line 205 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-KYqAtRswMPZ8-cPyYYp:-KYqAtRswMPZ8-cPyYYq:b-ybgstp) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/5ec295b6f19a95d0be4657bc7ffc2c6f9e2468e8/toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h#L205)):*
> ```objc
>  */
> bool tox_pass_encrypt(const uint8_t *plain, size_t plain_len, const uint8_t *passphrase, size_t passphrase_len,
>                       uint8_t *cipher, TOX_ERR_ENCRYPTION *error);
> ```

`cipher` as a name for output data is confusing, perhaps it should be renamed to e.g. `ciphertext`?
While at renaming, `plain` isn't that good either. Not sure if it could be renamed, given that `plaintext` isn't much more friendly (perhaps a bit).

Same goes for naming in other functions.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Review status: 0 of 6 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- *[toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h, line 205 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-KYqAtRswMPZ8-cPyYYp:-KYrsg4nTZ_5Y0l7fWWf:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/5ec295b6f19a95d0be4657bc7ffc2c6f9e2468e8/toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h#L205)):*
Previously, zetok wrote…
`cipher` as a name for output data is confusing, perhaps it should be renamed to e.g. `ciphertext`? While at renaming, `plain` isn't that good either. Not sure if it could be renamed, given that `plaintext` isn't much more friendly (perhaps a bit). Same goes for naming in other functions.
Done. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310)*

--- Reviewed 2 of 6 files at r2, 4 of 4 files at r3. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions. --- *[auto_tests/encryptsave_test.c, line 107 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-KYsU1Sn8jp9re0Ld_mi:-KYsU1Sn8jp9re0Ld_mj:bl4uvzl) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/6c800b655e25609c9441c63cfc6268617ba57be5/auto_tests/encryptsave_test.c#L107)):* > ```C > Tox_Pass_Key *key = tox_pass_key_new(); > ck_assert_msg(key != NULL, "pass key allocation failure"); > memcpy((uint8_t *)key, test_salt, 32); > ``` `key->salt` and `key->key` may be clearer. If you disagree, then maybe at least use `TOX_PASS_SALT_LENGTH` instead of 32 when comparing and using offsets. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-:-KYsV5JpB3YoL5U34IQ8:b-jbsf8z)*

Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r4.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion.

`key->salt` and `key->key` may be clearer. If you disagree, then maybe at least use `TOX_PASS_SALT_LENGTH` instead of 32 when comparing and using offsets.

Public API looks ok. --- Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-:-KYseZ6JvXt6HeUP1YA9:b-nre4g0)*
@nurupo we can make modifications or undo this change if you have reasons for that later. The 0.1.0 release is still gated on your LGTM. I will merge the toxencryptsave API soon.
Ok. I will have some reviewing time in 6 hours.

Reviewed 1 of 6 files at r2, 3 of 4 files at r3, 1 of 1 files at r4.

---

*[toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h, line 51 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-KYwTLCHbV_EVbgdBquI:-KYwTLCHbV_EVbgdBquJ:bn89b1o) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4cf69996cc16282b13615843febd68ff6355eb7d/toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h#L51)):*

*[toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h, line 263 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-KYwWUrpUA16Scb_B1bS:-KYwWUrpUA16Scb_B1bT:b8rqhqa) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4cf69996cc16282b13615843febd68ff6355eb7d/toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.h#L263)):*

>  */
> void tox_pass_key_free(struct Tox_Pass_Key *_key);
> ```

Why `_key`?

*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Reviewed 2 of 6 files at r2, 3 of 4 files at r3, 1 of 1 files at r4.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions, all commit checks successful.

---

*[toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.api.h, line 54 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-KYwlM6zYdC0ud5PjZos:-KYwlM6zYdC0ud5PjZot:blx48lc) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4cf69996cc16282b13615843febd68ff6355eb7d/toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.api.h#L54)):*
> ```objc
>  * ${pass_Key.derive}, then use the derived key to encrypt the data.
>  *
>  * The encrypted data is prepended with a magic number, to aid validity
> ```

Is the term here not cookie?

A magic number is something that makes things work, where why could easily unknown.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

*[toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.api.h, line 54 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310#-KYwlM6zYdC0ud5PjZos:-KZ-J0gyCTSpvXJLshk9:b-4de69x) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4cf69996cc16282b13615843febd68ff6355eb7d/toxencryptsave/toxencryptsave.api.h#L54)):*
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote…
Is the term here not cookie? A magic number is something that makes things work, where why could easily unknown.
Magic number is the correct term here https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magic_number_(programming). --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/310)*

commit.message:
Add apidsl file for toxencryptsave.

This breaks the toxencryptsave API. It hides the Tox_Pass_Key struct
definition.

This breaks the toxencryptsave API. It hides the Tox_Pass_Key struct
definition.
